data.title: There's a Cincinnati connection to Sunday's Golden Globes ceremony
data.text:
Could this be the old man and the Golden Globe?

Robert Redford, star of the Cincinnati-area shot "The Old Man & The Gun," is up for Best Actor in a Motion Picture Musical or Comedy at Sunday's Golden Globe Awards.

It is likely one of the legendary actor and director's last nominations. Redford announced he was retiring from acting in August of this year.

The biographical thriller was shot in Greater Cincinnati and Northern Kentucky in spring 2017.

Also with Casey Affleck, Elisabeth Moss, Sissy Spacek and Danny Glover, the film tells the true story of Forrest Tucker, who at 70, escaped prison and went on a string of bank heists.

Here's a closer look at the filming:

More: Robert Redford movie filming in Covington today

More: Robert Redford and film crew head to Bethel

More: Robert Redford film to shoot in Newport

The film premiered at the Telluride Film Festival Aug. 31, with a wide release on Sept. 28. It was warmly received by critics and made about $13 million at the box office.
